security: Revealing details about crop amounts, meat, and milk production, along with economic alignments and trade dynamics with Eastern Europe and Cuba, could jeopardize intelligence-gathering efforts. Direct quote: 'REPLACEMENT WITH MEAT AND MILK PRICES REMAINING...WILL SOVIET GOVERNMENT SEEK MORATORIUM ON ALL FOOD IMPORTS ARROAD, OR WILL IT CONTINUE HELP FOOD EASTERN EUROPE AND CUBA'.
summary: The document discusses Soviet agricultural conditions, potential food shortages, economic strategies related to imports and exports, and aid to Eastern Europe and Cuba.
summary_one_paragraph: This letter discusses Soviet agricultural production, noting that grain crop amounts and weight are below the last three years. It suggests the Soviet Union may face a situation where it has to choose between feeding its citizens and continuing to provide aid to Eastern Europe and Cuba. The document also refers to potential Soviet interest in fertilizer utilization and details about trade with the West for 'Chericas'.
title: POEX PRE IN CS FILE NO.
